prompt: What are the seven common patterns of AI identified in CPMAI?
answer: (1)Recognition/Pattern and Anomaly Detection (2)Conversation and Human Interaction (3)Goal‑driven Systems (4)Autonomous Systems (5)Predictive Analytics and Decision Support (6)Hyper‑personalization (7)Reasoning and Optimization

prompt: Which learning type uses labelled data: supervised, unsupervised, or reinforcement?
Which CPMAI phase focuses on clarifying business objectives and success criteria?
What is the gate decision called that determines whether an AI project moves from Data Preparation to Model Development?

answer: A model that performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data, capturing noise instead of signal.

prompt: Name at least three of the four Vs of Big Data.

answer: Degradation of model performance over time because real‑world data distribution changes from the training data.

prompt: Which EU regulation is shaping global discussions on AI risk categories?
List the six phases of the CPMAI methodology in order.
answer: (I) Business Understanding (II) Data Understanding (III) Data Preparation (IV) Model Development (V) Model Evaluation (VI) Model Operationalization & Lifecycle.

prompt: Explain the difference between bagging and boosting.
answer: Bagging builds independent models on bootstrapped samples and averages them; boosting builds models sequentially where each new model focuses on errors of the prior.

prompt: What practice ensures each data field has a clear owner and stewardship?

answer: Inputs crafted to intentionally fool an AI model into making incorrect predictions.
